bridge-type.label: Remote openHAB Server
bridge-type.description: A remote openHAB server. You will find one channel for each item defined in the remote server.

parameter.name: host
parameter.label: Server Address
parameter.description: The host name or IP address of the remote openHAB server.

parameter.name: useHttps
parameter.label: Use HTTPS
parameter.description: Set it to true in case you want to use HTTPS to communicate with the remote openHAB server. Default is false.

parameter.name: port
parameter.label: Server HTTP Port
parameter.description: The HTTP port to use to communicate with the remote openHAB server.

parameter.name: trustedCertificate
parameter.label: Trust SSL Certificate
parameter.description: Set it to true in case you want to use HTTPS even without a valid SSL certificate provided by your remote server.

parameter.name: restPath
parameter.label: REST API Path
parameter.description: The subpath of the REST API on the remote openHAB server.

parameter.name: token
parameter.label: Token
parameter.description: The token to use when the remote openHAB server is setup to require authorization to run its REST API.

parameter.name: username
parameter.label: Username
parameter.description: The username to use when the remote openHAB server is setup to require basic authorization to run its REST API.

parameter.name: password
parameter.label: Password
parameter.description: The password to use when the remote openHAB server is setup to require basic authorization to run its REST API.

parameter.name: authenticateAnyway
parameter.label: Authenticate Anyway
parameter.description: Set it to true in case you want to pass authentication information even when the communicate with the remote openHAB server is not secured (only HTTP). This is of course not recommended especially if your connection is over the Internet. Default is false.

parameter.name: accessibilityInterval
parameter.label: Accessibility Interval
parameter.description: Minutes between checking the remote server accessibility. 0 to disable the check. Default is 3.

parameter.name: aliveInterval
parameter.label: Alive Interval
parameter.description: Number of last minutes to consider when monitoring the receipt of events from the remote server. If an event is received during this interval, the remote server is considered alive and its accessibility will not be verified. Use 0 to disable this feature. Default is 5.

parameter.name: restartIfNoActivity
parameter.label: Restart if no Activity
parameter.description: Set it to true if you want to restart the connection (SSE) to the remote server when no events are received in the monitored interval. It is not necessary if the goal is to properly handle a short network outage (few seconds). This can be useful if you want to deal with a long network outage. Do not enable it if you remote server does not send events during the monitored interval under normal conditions, it will cause frequent restart of the connection and potential loss of events. Default is false.

thing-type.label: Remote Thing
thing-type.description: A thing from the remote openHAB server. You will find one channel for each trigger channel from the remote thing (state channels from the remote thing will be ignored).

parameter.name: thingUID
parameter.label: Remote Thing UID
parameter.description: The thing UID in the remote openHAB server.

parameter.name: buildTriggerChannels
parameter.label: Automatic Trigger Channels Building
parameter.description: If set to true, a trigger channel will be automatically created and linked to each trigger channel from the remote thing.

parameter.name: channelUID
parameter.label: Remote Channel UID
parameter.description: The channel UID in the remote openHAB server.
